Name Rascal/Expressions/Values/Set/Product

Syntax Exp1 * Exp2
Types
Exp1 Exp2 Exp1 * Exp2
set[T1] set[T2] rel[T1,T2]
Description Yields a relation resulting from the product of the values of Exp1 and Exp2. It contains a tuple for each combination of values from both arguments.
Examples 
rascal>{1, 2, 3} * {4, 5, 6};
rel[int, int]: {
  <2,4>,
  <3,5>,
  <1,6>,
  <2,5>,
  <3,4>,
  <1,5>,
  <2,6>,
  <1,4>,
  <3,6>
}
Questions
Question 1.
The type of {-16, 5, 8, 8, 19} * {6, 3} is

Question 2.
The type of {1.60047421819756400} * {-18.374808366196693200, -4.62883924725646000, -11.563629230758283200} is

Question 3. 
{8.87121547765777600, 3.89825632092164400, -0.36060181430455600, -8.400401495928666400} * {10.88915752664146000} ==
